title: With Malzahar once again being on the radar for nerfs maybe it's time to....
body:
Acknowledge that giving him a passive Spellshield wasn't exactly the best thing to do.

He's extremely opressive and nigh-untouchable in lane and when he's strong it feels like it's his lane to lose and not yours to win.
And even then he's extremely uninteractive with his constant shove and passive making you unable to actually engage him.

And that's coming from a Morde main who rejoices at his W healing me to max hp.

He doesn't need nerfs, he needs either a fully-fledged VGU or a different passive.

EDIT:
I'm not saying there is no counterplay to Malzahar but his mini rework promised making him more interactive in lane whereas it had the exact opposite effect.
It's just the combination of Permapushing play style, safety through his passive and the point and click suppression that basically guarantees a kill that's an issue.

He needs some work done to him, preferably a VGU because let's be honest...
He's pretty bloody outdated visually too

Malzahar’s rework was a complete failure by many points of view.
I’m not a Malz player but I’d play against the old one 100 times rather than a single game against the new one.

Here’s a list of issues with his new kit:
1) it killed many alternative playstyles like jungle/AD malz;
2) he became even more obnoxious in lane. Against the old one, you could just wait for him to waste his spells and gank him/all in him while he had everything on cooldown. Now he’s a push bot until 6.
3) he’s super hard to punish. Here you have some options against him:
-you pop his shield off but end up losing 40% of your Hp = trading was not worth;
-you try to farm under turret = he becomes relevant through farm and puts you behind by pressing EW;
-you try to shove harder than him but he’s fairly decent at farming under turret = he becomes relevant anyway because post 6 his ult is a guaranteed kill.
-you try to freeze and wait for a gank = he’ll at best waste flash, but a good Malz is as hard to gank as a Morgana just because he’ll EW every time his waveclear is off cooldown and go back to XP range.

His new Passive makes him miserable to play against. A champion that already had a passive-shove playstyle is now even more safe and pushes harder than before with little to no risk involved. 
Add the fact that he forces you to build QSS or you’re dead every time his ult is up, and you have why his rework accomplished nothing but making him a balance nightmare with that mess of a kit.
